result.execSummary:
The defendant Bradford A McDaid was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Unlawful Phone Use-Threatens Harm [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.012(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

with Huber.  This is a time served sentence.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bradford A McDaid

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: filed by attorney Daniel Mark Berkos

Defendant Bradford A McDaid in court with attorney Daniel Mark Berkos.  Brenda L. Yaskal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Rights/Elements.  Defendant pled no contest.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  Court sentenced defendant to serve 10 days in jail, with Huber.  $443.00 costs.  60 days to pay or set up a payment plan with Clerk of Courts.  9 days jail credit.  Court considers this is a time served sentence.
For Leave to File Additional Motions filed by Atty Genda
and Notice of DNA and Witness List filed by Atty Genda

No contact with M.R. and the Bank of Wis. Dells or any of their branches.  May return 1x with officer to the bank to get his funds.  Standard misd. conditions.

Defendant Bradford A McDaid by video, in custody with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Clifford Chase Burdon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  $1000.00 signature bond.  No contact with M.R. and the Bank of Wis. Dells or any of their branches.  May return 1x with officer to the bank to get his funds.  Standard misd. conditions.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 02:10 pm.  Return date scheduled for March 8, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
